contentrichtext.text: {{For|the candy bar|Wonka Xploder}} {{Unreferenced|date=September 2008}} '''Xploder''' is a brand of game cheats and multimedia devices for games consoles, similar to [[Action Replay]]. Xploder products have been released for [[PS2]], [[PlayStation (console)|PSone]], [[PlayStation Portable|PSP]], [[Xbox (console)|Xbox]], [[GameCube]], [[N64]], [[Game Boy]], [[Game Boy Advance]], [[IBM PC clone|PC]] and others. Support for the [[PlayStation 3|PS3]], [[Xbox 360]] and Nintendo [[Wii]] started in 2006-2007. Xploder products are often bundled with accessories for game consoles, such as [[Lexar]]'s [[Memory Stick]]s for the PSP, or the X-Link cable with the PS2 V5 Media Centre version. Newer versions for the [[Xbox 360]] and [[PlayStation 3]] allow users to download saved games from the Internet. Utilizing the Xploder disc for the original [[PlayStation (console)|PlayStation]], users have found it possible to boot backup or copied versions of their games. ==External links== *[http://www.xploder.net/ Xploder] *[http://www.xplodercheats.net/ Xploder Cheats] [[Category:Unlicensed Nintendo hardware]] [[Category:PlayStation 2 accessories]] [[Category:Video game cheating]] {{videogame-hardware-stub}}
